title: Great culture and benefits

title: Skip this place
cons: Toxic culture where they protect those engaging in bad behavior. High attrition rates. Limited upward mobility. People stay at same levels forever. Skip this one if you want to advance your career. Rigid and inflexible schedules. Cultivates institution of fear and intimidation

title: I wouldn't recommend
cons: truction team could benefit from better organization, but the team members are friendly and approachable, making collaboration easier.

title: Everything is just off here
pros: Good pay and benefits. Nice office.
cons: Where do I begin. The lack of communication between departments is horrible. The leadership and management is lacking greatly, which unfortunately comes from the CEO who hides in his office and loves to talk about himself. The flexibility allows everyone to come and go as they please leaving people mostly on their own.

title: Good benefits , typical financial corporate work environment
pros: Great benefits and growth opportunity, mixture of hotel and financial industry
cons: Need to know how to deal with corporate politics

title: Cost Cutting
pros: None that I can think of
cons: This company is only concerned with cutting costs and putting the money back in their own pockets. No consideration for how it affects employees or guests. Terrible people to work for. 0 out of 10, do not recommend. They're running properties and employees to the ground. Little staff, plenty of work, little hours.

title: Review
